Curried Coconut Chicken

Chicken – 1 kg {boneless,skinless chicken, cut into pieces}
Salt and pepper – 1 tsp
Oil – 1 1/2 tbsp
Curry powder – 2 tbsp
onion – 1 {sliced}
Garlic – 2 cloves [crushed]
Coconut milk – 2 cups
Tomatoes – 2
Tomato sauce – 4tbsp
Sugar – 3 tbsp

1. Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
2. Heat oil and curry powder in a large skillet over medium-high heat for two minutes.
3. Stir in onions and garlic, and cook 1 minute more. 4. Add chicken, tossing lightly to coat with curry oil.
5. Reduce heat to medium, and cook for 7 to 10 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear
6. minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear.
Pour coconut milk, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and sugar into the pan, and stir to combine.
7. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, approximately 30 to 40 minutes.
Karivepaku Kodi Kura

Curry leaves – 25 gms
Coriander Leaves – 15 gms
Green Chillies – 25 gms
Cashew Nuts – 25 gms
Fresh Coconut – 25 gms
Coriander Seeds – 1/2 tsp
Onions – 250 gms [chopped]
Chilli Powder – 1/2 tsp
Turmeric Powder – 1/4 tsp
Water – 300 ml
Cinnamon – 1 stick
Cardamom – 3 nos
Cloves – 3 nos
Ginger Garlic Paste – 1 tsp
Coriander Powder – 1/2 tsp
Chicken – 500 gms
Oil – 5 tbsp

1. Heat two tablespoons of oil in a pan and add curry leaves, coriander leaves, green chillies, fresh coconut, cashew nuts and coriander seeds saute for 3 to 4 minutes
2. Cool and grind to a smooth paste.
3. Heat remaining oil in a pan add chopped onions sauté till brown.
4. Add ginger garlic paste and sauté.
5. Add whole garam masala, turmeric, chilli powder, coriander powder and sauté.
6. Add the coconut and cashewnut paste and sauté.
7. Add chicken pieces and water.
8. Mix and let it simmer till the chicken gets cooked.
9. Garnish with a sprig of coriander leaf and serve hot with plain rice.
Chingri Malai Curry

Coconut milk – 1 1/4 cup
Garam masala powder – 1 tsp
Sugar – 2 tsp
Turmeric powder – 1 tsp
Chilli powder – 1 tsp
Cumin powder – 2 tsp
Cumin paste – 1 tsp
Whole cumin – 1/2 tsp
Oil – 3 tbsp
Prawn – 400 gms
Ghee – 2 tsp
Salt to taste

1. Blanch the prawns in turmeric water.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and add sugar and whole cumin.
3. Add ginger paste, cumin powder, red chilli powder and turmeric powder and saut?
4. Now add the prawns and slit green chillies and stir for few minutes.
5. Add the coconut milk, cook for few more minutes and then add salt.
6. In the end sprinkle garam masala and ghee on top and serve.
Palak Chicken

Chicken: Half Kilo Gram (boneless)
Oil: One spoon
Cinnamon: small piece
Cloves: four
Cardamom: two
Onions: two
Spinach: 2 cups
Ginger and Garlic paste: one and half spoon
Turmeric Powder: Pinch
Salt and Chilli Powder: Enough to taste
Butter: a little

1.Clean chicken with water and Cut Chicken into small pieces
2.Add chilli powder, a little salt, pinch of Turmeric powder to chicken and mix well
3.Cut Spinach into small pieces and boil it in two cups of water. Remove water if any after boiling of spinach and paste the spinach in mixy.
4.Add some oil in Pan, after the oil is heated add cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, onion pieces and fry them. Enriching the flavor of ginger and garlic paste
5.After some time add spinach mixture, turmeric powder, salt and cover it.
6. After 5 to 6 minutes add chicken to this mixture and keep stove in low heat.
7.Keep it for some time and check if chicken cooked or not.
8.Add some butter to it. And serve hot
Noodles Omelette

4 Eggs
1 onion (finely chopped)
1/2 cup noodles boiled
1 table spoon green coriander finely chopped
2 table spoon cheeses grated
1 tea spoon green green chillies finely chopped
2 table spoons butter or Oil
Salt to taste
1/2 Tea spoon black pepper powder

1. Break eggs and beat till puffy. Mix noodles, onion, green coriander and black pepper to the beaten eggs\n2. Heat butter or oil in a frying pan. mix salt and pour the egg mixture in a pan. Sprinkle black pepper and cheese and cook omelette on low heat from both sides.\n3. Serve hot with sauce or chutney.
Omelette packet with Paneer

2 eggs
1 medium size onion (finely chopped)
2 green chillies (finely chopped)
1 table spoon green coriander finely chopped
3/4 tea spoon black pepper
2 table spoon milk
250 grams fresh paneer
2 cheese slices
2 table spoon butter
Salt to taste

1. Cut paneer to the size of cheese slices
2. Break eggs and keep yolks and whites separately. Mix two table spoons of milk and beat the white till puffy. Add yolk and beat again.
3. Melt a table spoon full of butter in a frying pan. Add 1/2 of chopped onion, 1/2 of chopped green chillies and 1/2 of green coriander to the beaten egg and prepare an omelette
4. Sprinkle 1/2 of salt and black pepper on the omelette and fry both the sides. Put paneer slices in the centre and fold the omelette like a packet from all the sides towards the centre.
5. Serve this omelette packet with salad
6. Prepare other omelettes the same way.
Chettinad Chicken roast

Chicken – 1 kg Cut medium pieces
For manination:
Lemon juice – 2 tbsp
Ginger garlic paste – 1 tbsp
Coriander powder – 2 tbsp
Turmeric powder – 1/2 tsp
Chilli powder – 2 tbsp
salt to taste
FOR MASALA:
Oil – 1 tbsp
Ginger garlic paste – 1 tbsp
Cumin seeds – 1 tsp
Onion – 1
Fennel seeds – 2 tbsp
Tomatoes – 2 {chopped}
FOR SEASONING:
Oil – 1 tbsp
Dry red chillies – 3
Curry leaves – 3 tbsp
Onion – 1 {sliced very thin}
Crushed pepper – 1 tsp
Garam masala powder – 1 tsp

1. Wash and drain the chicken.
2. Combine all the marination ingredients in a bowl and add the chicken pieces and marinate for a minimum of 30 minutes.
3. In a pan, heat oil and add fennel and cumin seeds.
4. Add onions and saute till soft.
5. Add ginger garlic paste and saute for a few minutes.
6. Add tomatoes and saute till oil starts oozing.
7. Add the marinated chicken and cover and cook till chicken is done.
8. As this is a dry preparation, no need to add water as chicken gets cooked in its own juice.
9. In another pan, heat oil and add red chillies, followed by curry leaves and onion.
10. Fry till onion turns brown.
11. Add crushed pepper and garam masala and saute till you get a nice aroma.
13. Serve hot with rice, appam, parotta, roti etc…
Chettinad Mutton Curry

Mutton – 1 kg
MASALA FOR GRINDING:
Coconut – 1 cup
Poppya seeds – 1 tbsp
Coriander seeds – 2 tsp
Fennel seeds – 1.5 tsp
Cumin seeds – 1.5 tsp
Dry red chillies – 8
Green cardamom – 3
Cloves – 4
Cinnamon 1.5 stick
Water for griding – 1/2 cup

Oil – 3 tbsp
onion – 1
Ginger – 1 tbsp{minced}
Garlic – 1 tbsp {minced}
Turmeric powder – 1/2 tsp
Curry leaves – 3 tbsp
Tomatoes – 2
Lemonjuice – 2 tbsp
Water – 3 cups
Coriander leaves – 4 tbsp
Salt to taste

1. fry roast on low heat – Cinnamon Stick, Cloves, Green Cardamom, Red Chillies, Cumin Seeds, Fennel Seeds, Coriander Seeds and Poppy Seeds.
2. Keep stirring till the seeds change color and there is a fantastic aroma.
3. Add in the the Coconut and again, stir till the coconut gets a color and looks dry and dehydrated.
4. Once done, transfer and allow it to cool.
5. Grind to a smooth paste using 1/2 cup of Water and keep aside till ready to use.
6. In a pan, heat the Oil on medium flame and once hot, add in the Onions.
7. Salt the Onions just a bit and cook till translucent.
8. . Add in the Minced Ginger and Garlic, Turmeric Powder, Curry Leaves, Spice Paste and Red Chili Powder.
9. Cook for a minute.
10. Add in the Tomatoes, mix and cook uncovered till the oil separates from the mixture.
11. Add in the Chicken, mix and cook for 5 minutes.
12. Add Salt and a squeeze of Lime or Lemon and mix well again.
13. Add in Water for gravy as needed, mix and cover and cook for 20-25 minutes.
14. Once done, garnish with Cilantro just before serving.
15. Enjoy this dish with Rice, Chapatis, Naans, Parathas, Idlis or Dosas.
Kottyam Fish Curry

INGREDIENTS:
Coriander powder – 1 tbsp
Coco nut oil – 1 tbsp
Tamarind pulp – 3 tbsp
Ginger – 2 tbsp
Turmeric powder – 1/2 tsp
Chilli powder – 1/2 tsp
Coconut milk – 1/2 cup
Water – 2 cups
Fennel seeds – 1 tsp 
Mustard seeds – 1 tsp
Fenugreek seeds – 1/2 ts
Salt to taste
Green chillies – 4
Curry leaves – 1 spring
Onion – 1
Tomato – 1
Curry leaves – few for garnish
Ginger – julienne, for garnish
Coconut milk – few drops for garnish
Tilipia Fish – 1 kg

1. Cut and wash the Fish to bite-size pieces.
2. n a pan, on medium-high heat, heat Oil and add in the Fenugreek Seeds.
3. Add in the Mustard Seeds and allow them to splutter.
4. Add in Fennel Seeds and mix.
5. Add in the Ginger, Onions, Green Chillies and Curry Leaves.
6. Sprinkle a little Salt and allow it to cook till the Onions turn translucent.
7. Add in the Tomatoes and allow them to cook and soften, about 5 min.
8. Lower heat and add in the dry spices – Turmeric Powder, Kashimiri Chili Powder and Coriander Powder.
9. Add a little water to avoid the dry spices burning and cook for about 2-3 min.
10. Add in the Tamarind Pulp and cook for another 2-3 min.
11. Add in Water, increase the heat and allow the gravy to cook well for approx 5 min.
12. dd in the Fish pieces and mix gently.
13. Allow the for for about 3-4 min, reduce flame and add Coconut Milk.
14. Allow the gravy to come to another boil for another minute.
15. . Garnish with Curry Leaves, julienne Ginger and a few drops of Coconut Oil
16. Serve hot over some white rice.
Mushroom Pepper Fry

25 Nos Mushroom
2 Nos Onion
6 Nos Green Chillies
1 No Capsicum
1 Strand Curry Leaves
1/4 tspn Mustard
1/4 tspn Cumin Powder
2.5 tblspn Pepper Powder
1/4 tspn Ginger Garlic Paster
to taste Salt 
2 tblspn Cooking oil

1.Remove the stem of mushroom and chop the Mushrooms and wash them well.Chop the onions, green chillies and capsicum.
2.In a Pan heat the cooking oil and sauté the sliced onions when they get translucent add curry leaves and sauté in high flame until all the watery contents get dried up.
3.Add chopped capsicum, green chillies to the pan and keep it for 3-5 minutes.
4.Keep this aside and take another pan, add some cooking oil. (Next step is to fry the mushrooms).
5.Add cumin powder to the pan and add the sliced mushrooms. Cook it well until the mushroom becomes tender. Add a pinch of salt to mushroom.
6.Add masala which has already prepared to the mushroom, mix both well.
7.cover the pan for 2-3 mints and serve it hot.
Tip
Before frying the Mushroom use some towel/paper to remove the water content. This will be helpful for frying, otherwise the water content in the mushroom will be extracted while frying. You wouldn't be able to fry it properly.
Prawns Masala

1 Kg Prawns 
5 Oninons 
3 Tomato 
2.5 teaspoons Ginger Garlic paste 
2 tablespoons Red Chilli Powder 
1 teaspoon Turmeric 
1 Tablespoon Coriander Spoon 
1/2 Tablespoon Garam Masala
5 Chilli 
2 sprig Curry Leaves 
to garnish Chopped Coriander Leaves 
2 Tablespoons Vinegar or Lime Juice 
7 Tablespoon oil 
1/2 teaspoon Mustard seeds 
to taste Salt 
1/2 Cup Wate

1.Remove and clean the prawns with marinated salt.
2.Marinate the prawns with 1/2 tablespoon, 2 tablespoon red chilli powder, 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste and vinegar. use either vinegar or lime juice. Keep this for 30 minutes.
3.Add 7 tablespoon oil, heat it well and splutter mustard seeds.
4.Add finely chopped onions saute it, ginger garlic paste. fry until the onion becomes golden brown.
5.Add masala, Once the onion turns golden brown, add chopped tomato and finely chopped chillies. cook it for 3-4 minutes.
6.Make sure that tomato is mashed. Add 2 sprigs of curry leaves and mix it well.
7.Add prawns and mix it well with the masala.
8.Close the lid and cook it for another 5 minutes.
9.add water to the prawns masala, add salt to taste. cook it be not closing the lid.
10.Serve it hot once the masala becomes thicker.
Spicy Madras Cicken

8 bone-in chicken breast halves, skin removed 
salt and pepper to taste 
1 tablespoon olive oil 
2 onions, peeled and quartered 
1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh ginger 
1 teaspoon crushed garlic 
1 tablespoon hot (Madras) curry powder 
400g tomato paste 
1 (400ml) tin coconut milk 
4 whole cloves 
4 pods cardamom 
1 cinnamon stick 
salt to taste

1.Rinse chicken and pat dry; season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium high heat, then saute chicken until browned. Remove chicken from pan and set aside.
2.Saute onions in pan until translucent; add ginger and garlic and saute until fragrant, then stir in curry powder.
3.Return chicken to pan and add tomato sauce, coconut milk, cloves, cardamom and cinnamon stick. Season with salt to taste and stir all together.
4.Reduce heat to low and simmer until chicken is tender and cooked through (no longer pink inside), about 20 to 25 minutes.
Pumpkin Tamarind curry

1 tablespoon Cooking oil 
1 teaspoon Mustard 
1/4 teaspoon Cumin 
1 teaspoon Ginger garlic paste 
2 Green chilies cut small 
5-6 Curry leaves 
2 medium Onions cut small 
1 tablespoon Corriander powder 
1 teaspoon Red chili powder 
1/2 teaspoon Turmeric powder 
2 cups medium sized cubes of pumpkin 
Salt to taste 
1 1/2 cup water
1 teaspoon Thick tamarind paste

1.Heat oil in a deep pan. Add mustard and let splutter. Add cumin, ginger garlic paste, green chili, curry leaves and onion and sauté well until onion starts turning golden brown.\n2.Now add coriander powder, red chili powder and turmeric powder. Mix well for a minute and add pumpkin, salt and 1 cup water. Cook covered on low flame.\n3.When almost done, add tamarind paste and the ½ cup water left. Cook uncovered until done and all water is used up.
Shrimp Kofta Recipe

1.-- For Making Gravy --1.Finely Chopped Onion - 1 
2.Finely chopped tomato - 1 
3.Finely chopped green chili - 1 
4.Coriander leaf - 20 
5.Ginger garlic paste - 1 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
6.Thick fresh coconut milk - 1/2 cup 
7.Coriander powder - 1 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
8.Black pepper powder - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
9.Fennel seed powder - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
10.Chili powder - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
11.Cinnamon stick - 1 small piece 
12.Oil - 3 teaspoon (tsp.) 
13.Salt - as needed. 
2.-- Grind to Paste --1.Shrimp - 1/2 cup 
2.Onion - 1 
3.Green chili - 2 
4.Shredded coconut - 2 tablespoon (tbsp.) 
5.Roasted gram - 1 1/2 tablespoon (tbsp.) 
6.Ginger garlic paste - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
7.Black pepper powder - 1/4 teaspoon (tsp.) 
8.Cumin seed powder - 1/4 teaspoon (tsp.) 
9.Turmeric powder - 1/4 teaspoon (tsp.) 
10.Salt - as needed.

1.Grind the ingredients under the section 'Grind to Paste' to a thick paste. 
2.In a pan heat oil. Now add cinnamon stick, onion, green chili and sauté until the onion turns golden brown. 
3.Now add ginger garlic paste and sauté until raw smell is gone. 
4.Now add chili powder and sauté until oil separates. 
5.Now add tomato and sauté until oil separates. 
6.Now add coriander powder, black pepper powder, cumin powder, fennel powder, turmeric powder, salt, coconut milk, 1 cup of water. Boil and cook this until the raw smell is gone. 
7.Now make small balls out of the ground paste and drop into the boiling gravy. Lower the heat and cook until the shrimp balls are cooked. NOTE: once the balls are cooked they will start to float. 
8.Remove the gravy from stove. Add coriander leaf mix well and serve.
Squid (Kanava) Vadai Recipe

1.Squid (Kanava) - 5 
2.Cabbage - 1/4 cup 
3.Carrot - 3 teaspoon (tsp) 
4.Hot green chili - 1 
5.Black pepper - 1 teaspoon (tsp) 
6.Fennel seed - 1 teaspoon (tsp) 
7.Salt - to taste 
8.Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup 
9.Curry leaves (optional) - 10 
10.Turmeric powder - 1/4 teaspoon (tsp) 
11.Oil - to fry 
12.Onion - 1

1.Cut onion, cabbage, carrot, hot green chili, coriander leaves, curry leaves into fine pieces. 
2.Ground squid and black pepper in a blender. 
3.Mix the ground squid and the cut ingredients( onion, cabbage, carrot, hot green chili, coriander leaves, curry leaves), salt for taste, fennel seeds, Turmeric powder and keep aside for 1 hour. 
4.Heat the oil to fry. 
5.Now make small balls, flatten them, make a hole in the middle and fry them in hot oil until done.
Squid curry recipe

1.Squid - 400 grams 
2.Potato - 150 grams 
3.Onion - 2 
4.Fennel seed - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
5.Fenugreek seed - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
6.Mustard seed - 1/4 teaspoon (tsp.) 
7.Ginger paste - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
8.Garlic paste - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
9.Curry leaves - 10 
10.Curry masala powder - 2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
11.Turmeric powder - 1/4 teaspoon (tsp.) 
12.Water - 1 cup 
13.Oil - 2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
14.Salt - to taste

1.Clean and cut the squid into rings or small pieces. 
2.Add turmeric powder, salt to taste, curry masala powder to squid mix well and marinate them. 
3.Slice onions. Cut potato into fine pieces. 
4.In a pan heat oil, add mustard seed, fennel seed, fenugreek seed. Once the mustard seed start to splatter add the onion and cook until it turns golden brown. 
5.Now add the marinated squid, ginger, garlic paste and cook until the raw smell is gone. 
6.Now add the potato, 1 cup water and mix well. Simmer and cook for 15 minutes until the potato is cooked well. Remove the curry form heat garnish with curry leaves and serve. NOTE: stir time to time so the curry does not get burnt.
Mughlai Mutton Masala Recipe

1.Mutton (goat or lamb) - 1/2 kilo gram (cut into 1 inch cubes) 
2.Oil - 4 tablespoon (tbsp)
3.Ghee - 4 tablespoon (tbsp)
4.Ginger garlic paste - 3 tablespoon (tbsp)
5.Onion - 300 to 400 grams 
6.Hot green chili - 3 
7.Hot dry chili - 5 
8.Cinnamon stick - 1 inch 
9.Cardamom - 3 
10.Cloves - 3 
11.Coriander seeds - 3 teaspoon (tsp)
12.Cumin seeds - 1 teaspoon (tsp)
13.Black pepper - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp)
14.Turmeric powder - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp)
15.Yogurt - 1 cup 
16.Mint leaves - 1/4 cup 
17.Coriander leaves - 1/4 cup 
18.Salt - to taste

1.Heat the pan and melt the ghee. Now add the mutton and fry until the all the water is evaporated. 
2.Cut onion, coriander leaves, mint leaves and hot chili into fine pieces. 
3.Grind onion, cinnamon stick, cloves, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, black pepper, turmeric powder, green chili, dry chili, into a fine paste add water as needed. 
4.Heat oil in pressure cooker add ginger garlic paste and cook for 2-3 min until the raw smell goes away. 
5.Now add the ground ingredients and cook until oil separates. 
6.Now add the yogurt, mutton and cook for 5 min. 
7.Now add salt as needed, mint leaves, coriander leaves and cook for 2-3 min. 
8.If you need water add little water and pressure cook for 4 whistle. If the mutton has more water cook until its thick to your preference and serve. 
NOTES:
1.If cook this in a pan, simmer and cook until the meat is well done and serve.
Aatukal (Goat Trotters) Paya Recipe

1.Aatukal (goat or lamb trotters) - 4 
2.Ginger garlic paste - 2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
3.Coriander leaf - 15 or as needed for garnish 
4.Thinly sliced onion - 2 
5.Finely chopped tomato - 2 
6.Chili powder - 2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
7.Garam masala powder - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
8.Black pepper powder - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
9.Coriander powder - 3 teaspoon (tsp.) 
10.Cinnamon stick - 1 inch 
11.Cardamom - 1 
12.Clove - 1 
13.Bay leaf - 1 
14.Oil - 50 milliliter 
15.Salt - as needed

1.In a pressure cooker heat oil. Now add cinnamon stick, clove, cardamom, bay leaf until the start to smell. 
2.Now add onion and sauté until it turns translucent (golden brown). 
3.Now add ginger garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell is gone. 
4.Now add the Aatukal (goat or lamb trotters) cover with a lid and cook in medium heat for 5 minutes. 
5.Now add chili powder and sauté for 1 minute. 
6.Now add coriander powder, black pepper powder and sauté for a minute. 
7.Now add tomato, salt as needed, 3 liter of water and pressure cook for 1/2 an hour or 6 to 7 whistle. 
8.Once the pressure is released. Place it in heat (stove) and cook until oil starts to float. Now add garam masala powder, coriander leaf. Remove from heat (stove) and serve.
Fish Masala Kurma Recipe

1.Fish - 1/2 kilogram 
2.Soy flour - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
3.Finely chopped tomato - 2 
4.Finely chopped onion - 1 
5.Finely chopped garlic - 10 cloves 
6.Finely chopped ginger - 1 inch 
7.Coconut milk - 3 cup 
8.Chili powder - 1 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
9.Turmeric powder - 1 pinch 
10.Coriander powder - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
11.Cumin powder - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
12.Black pepper powder - 1/2 teaspoon (tsp.) 
13.Lemon juice - 1 teaspoon (tsp.) 
14.Coriander leaf - 1/2 bunch 
15.Cinnamon stick - 2 inch pieces 
16.Cardamom - 2 
17.Cloves - 5 
18.Oil - 3 teaspoon (tsp.) 
19.Salt - to taste

1.Add turmeric powder, half of chili powder, corn flour, salt to taste mix well and marinate for 1/2 hour. 
2.Heat oil in a pan; and fry the fish half cooked and keep it aside. 
3.In the same pan add cinnamon stick, cardamom, cloves, onion and sauté until onion turns golden brown. 
4.Now add ginger garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell is gone. Now add tomato and cook until oil separates. 
5.Now add coconut milk, turmeric powder, rest of the chili powder, coriander powder, black pepper powder, salt to taste, water as needed and bring to boil. 
6.Now add the fried fish and cook until the fish is cooked and the right consistency for the kurma is reached. 
7.Now add the lemon juice, garnish with coriander leaves. Remove from heat and serve. 
NOTES:
1.If you want thick kurma, instead of coconut milk you add ground coconut paste.
